findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The transactions are initially disabled for all users excluding authorized addresses and can be enabled by the owner, but cannot be disabled again. Additionally, an anti-bot mechanism restricts users from transacting more frequently than a specified cooldown period.

findings.title: CR - Code Repetition
findings.description: The contract contains repetitive code segments which can lead to issues like gas efficiency, complexity, readability, security, and maintainability of the source code.

findings.title: DDP - Decimal Division Precision
findings.description: Division of decimal (fixed point) numbers can result in rounding errors due to the way that division is implemented in Solidity, leading to issues with precise calculations with decimal numbers.

findings.title: MEM - Missing Error Messages
findings.description: The contract is using missing error messages. There is no error message to accurately reflect the problem, making it difficult to identify and fix the issue.

findings.title: PLPI - Potential Liquidity Provision Inadequacy
findings.description: The contract operates under the assumption that liquidity is consistently provided to the pair between the contract's token and the native currency. However, there is a possibility that liquidity is provided to a different pair.

findings.title: RFO - Redundant Function Overrides
findings.description: The contract overrides the `decimals` function without changing the default function definition, making the override redundant.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 have native functionality for arithmetic operations that revert to underflow and overflow.

findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract modifies the state of variables without checking if their current value is the same as the one given as an argument, leading to redundant storage writes and unnecessary gas consumption.

findings.title: RSD - Redundant Swap Duplication
findings.description: The contract contains multiple swap methods that individually perform token swaps and transfer promotional amounts to specific addresses and features, introducing unnecessary complexity and increasing gas consumption.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not conform to the Solidity naming conventions, which can lead to decreased readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L15 - Local Scope Variable Shadowing
findings.description: Local scope variable shadowing occurs when a local variable with the same name as a variable in an outer scope is declared within a function or code block.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured from user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.

findings.title: L18 - Multiple Pragma Directives
findings.description: If the contract includes multiple conflicting pragma directives, it may produce unexpected errors.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The `^` symbol indicates that any version of Solidity that is compatible with the specified version (i.e., any version that is a higher minor or patch version) can be used to compile the contract. The version lock is a mechanism that allows the author to specify a minimum version of the Solidity compiler that must be used to compile the contract code.
